text: he's the longest-serving British Asian
MP first elected in less East for labour
back in 1987 he rose the ranks to become
the Europe Minister in Tony Blair's
government and in recent years he's
become well known for his role as chair
of the Council Home Affairs Select
Committee with many well-known figures
and politicians facing his scrutiny but
after allegations in a Sunday paper
involving mr. Vaz and male escorts he
came under pressure to step down welcome
to The Daily pollen a local Conservative
councillor in Leicester said he should
quit as an MP - I think Keith needs to
consider where do you think this could
eventually end right and actually would
he be doing actually the public and
Parliament a service by actually and his
family by standing down now but others
say mr. Blair's deserves another chance
don't judge somebody on one mistake they
make in their life or even a couple of
mistakes I mean it's the total that he's
done for other people right the way in
his own constituency and up and down
Britain he's always been on the side of
justice and that can't just will be
swept away by one mistake that he's made
mr. Vaz has referred the allegations to
his lawyers there's no suggestion he's
done anything illegal the issue is how
damaging the claims are to his
credibility and political career
Elin Agana BBC News Westminster
